{"title":"page 30","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"30
policeman on night duty nearest the same shall
instantly repair to the place where the noise or
disturbance occurs and quiet the same, and if any
breach of the laws has taken place he shall arrest
the offender or offenders; and if he needs assistance, or is opposed in the performance of his duty,
he shall spring his rattle, and the policemen who
may hear it shall answer the same, and- forthwith
proceed in haste to the assistance of the policeman
who first sprung his rattle.
Sec. 18. It shall be the duty of policemen to
disperse all unlawful assemblages of negroes and
slaves; they shall also disperse negroes and slaves
congregated on the sidewalks in front of Cabarets;
they must likewise keep a sharp lookout for all
cabarets or grog-shops where spirituous liquors are
sold to negroes and slaves, and report the same
without delay to their commanding officer.
Sec. 19. They shall arrest forthwith every slave
found drinking spirituous liquor in a Cabaret.
Seo. 20. It shall be their duty to arrest and
convey to the Police Station House every slave
who may be found to have in his possession any
fire-arms or concealed weapons.","fullrs":{},"find":"2669.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2668","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"435449","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.42 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
